channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Vice President Mike Pence is self-isolating after press secretary tested positive for coronavirus
item.description: Vice President Mike Pence (left) is denying that he is self-isolating after his press secretary, Katie Miller (right), tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Boris Johnson finally sets out tentative three-stage 'exit plan' from coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The Prime Minister last night plotted the first baby steps out of lockdown which will see those who cannot work from home actively encouraged to return to their jobs today.

item.title: Steph & Dom solve your sex, love & life troubles: Corona cash crisis is wrecking our marriage
item.description: An anonymous reader asked British TV's Steph and Dom Parker for advice. The mother-of-two reveals there's been tension in her marriage since her husband was made redundant.

item.title: Editing social media photos to improve appearance 'may lead to eating disorders' research suggests
item.description: Florida State University research shows posting Instagram photos increases anxiety. Digitally altering photos to improve appearance was shown to increase worries about body weight.

item.title: Dramatic moment off-duty police officer saves the life of hiker, 24, stuck in a violent whirlpool
item.description: The 24-year-old man from Fresno, who has not been identified, had been hiking the secluded Angel Falls crossing along the Willow Creek Trail above Bass Lake in central California on Saturday.

item.title: Rav Wilding 'joins his brothers and sisters in the trenches'
item.description: Rav Wilding, 42, who has hosted Crimewatch since 2004, will 'dust off the cuffs' to join his fellow officers on the frontline amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Boris Johnson says schools will start to reopen from June 1 'at the earliest'
item.description: The PM said pupils in reception, Year 1 and Year 6 will be the first to go back from the start of the month during the staged process for the UK.

item.title: Stay off public transport if you want to stay healthy, Boris Johnson says
item.description: Keeping two metres apart will mean public transport can only accommodate a tenth of pre-coronavirus passenger numbers.

item.title: Iranian destroyer accidentally opens fire on one of its own warships
item.description: There are 40 naval personnel missing in the incident, according to local media reports this evening.

item.title: DOMINIC LAWSON: The return of the fox-killing barrister and a bid to exploit the PPE crisis
item.description: DOMINIC LAWSON: Attention-seekers sometimes pay a price for their vanity. One such is the lawyer Jolyon Maugham.

item.title: Business leaders demand answers on how PM's lockdown easing will work
item.description: UK firms want to know if the Government programme to pay the wages of furlough ed workers will be extended beyond the end of June. Pictured: Dame Carolyn Fairbairn of the CBI.

item.title: Government 'will keep topping up wages of furloughed staff if they can only return part-time'
item.description: UK businesses are to be given an incentive to gradually bring staff back to work so social distancing rules can be observed. Pictured: The Chancellor.

item.title: TV's Normal People features an eye-watering 41 MINUTES of sex across its 12 episodes
item.description: BBC drama Normal People has become the network's sauciest show, thanks to its eye-watering number of sex scenes.

item.title: Saracens 'sued by former star Hankin after he was allegedly hit on the head with fire extinguisher'
item.description: Troubled Saracens are facing another legal battle as one of their former players, Matt Hankin, claims his career was wrecked during a club tour to Hugary.

item.title: Christopher Stevens on the weekend's TV: like being force-fed custard slices, it'll leave you queasy
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: While watching The Fantastical Factory Of Curious Craft (C4), you realise this horrendous offering is not so much a new TV format as an episode of manic delirium.

item.title: Leave delivery parcels for 72 hours before opening them to cut the risk of catching coronavirus
item.description: Researchers from the Universities of Bath, Bristol and Southampton hope the Germ Defence website, repurposed for coronavirus, will change people's behaviours and cut infections.

item.title: Joanna Lumley calls for an end to stag and hen parties abroad to help save the planet
item.description: Joanna Lumley has called for an end to foreign stag and hen parties to help save the planet - and said revellers should use their local pub instead.

item.title: A few sparky initiatives... then a giant wet blanket
item.description: HENRY DEEDES: No whizz. No bang, No fizz or pop. The Prime Minister's Sunday night sermon was a pyrotechnic-free affair.

item.title: Travellers between Britain and France will NOT face two-week quarantine
item.description: Britain and France said any quarantine measure would be reciprocal and only be imposed after mutual consultation despite Boris Johnson suggesting all countries would face the move.

item.title: New care home test fiasco: Ministers accused of 'betraying' nursing homes following failed promises
item.description: Ministers were accused of 'betraying' care homes (left) on Sunday after failing to meet a promise to provide coronavirus tests for all staff and residents.

item.title: Secondary pupils will miss more than a term of school and most will not return until September
item.description: Doubts have been raised over whether many will be ready to take GCSEs and A Levels next year. Boris Johnson announced primary pupils in England could return to school as early as June 1.

item.title: My lightbulb moment: Chutney queen Geeta Samtani
item.description: Geeta Samtani, now in her 70s, who lives in London, founded Geeta's Food 30 years ago. The mother-of-two revealed her inspiration came after experimenting with her mother's chutney recipe.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: It's hard to see what else Boris Johnson could have done
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: The Prime Minister was firm that there will be no early end to the lockdown, and clear in his determination to avoid a second peak that might overwhelm the NHS.

item.title: Ready-made first aid kits are often bulked out with unnecessary items, investigation reveals
item.description: Ready-made first aid kits from shops are often a rip-off because they are bulked out with unnecessary items, according to consumer watchdogs.

item.title: Champions League stars and Formula 1 drivers to be exempt from 14-day coronavirus travel quarantine
item.description: Elite sports stars are to be made exempt from the 14-day coronavirus quarantine as the government looks to allow for the return of international tournaments, according to reports.

item.title: Data breach left millions of car trips exposed
item.description: Police and council chiefs who operated the system have apologised for the blunder, which is being investigated by the Information Commissioner's Office which can impose fines.

item.title: Well that didn't last long! After Saturday's 77F sizzler, temperatures plummet due to Arctic winds
item.description: Britain had been basking in balmy sunshine that would have put the Med in the shade. But yesterday temperatures plummeted as an Arctic blast rushed in - and they are set to fall even further today.

item.title: Caught red-handed: Bungling burglar caught by police after leaving his own paperwork at crime scene
item.description: Burglar Terry Williams, 41, proved very easy to trace after leaving paperwork with his own name on it at the scene of his crime. He left a trail of evidence when breaking into three homes in just a few hours.

item.title: Relief for the fun police as Boris Johnson eases lockdown restrictions
item.description: Addressing the nation this evening, the Prime Minister announced that from Wednesday Britons will be allowed sunbathe in parks, drive to other destinations and even play sports with their families.

item.title: Two men are arrested after a person is shot during a rabbit hunt on Suffolk farmland
item.description: The 27-year-old victim was taken to hospital where he is being treated for a chest wound.

item.title: Pubs are told to stay closed until July - and it could be MONTHS before you can get a haircut
item.description: The British Beer & Pub Association has slammed the government's exit strategy, warning that the sector remains in 'limbo' and faces 'severe uncertainty and financial devastation'.

item.title: Bull with an itch to scratch leaves 800 homes without power
item.description: Ron, who weighs more than a ton, managed to avoid the box as it landed in his field in South Lanarkshire - and an 11,000-volt shock from the tumbling cables.

item.title: Media watchdog urged to investigate Channel 4 of Margoyles's comments
item.description: Yesterday there was growing anger about the way the broadcaster has handled the hugely controversial remarks made on Friday night's episode of chat show The Last Leg.

item.title: More than 1,000 people form a half-mile long queue for free food in Geneva
item.description: The line of people stretched for more than 1 km (half a mile) outside an ice rink where volunteers were handing out around 1,500 parcels to people who started queuing as early as 5am.

item.title: Top statistician accuses government of MISLEADING the public as pressure mounts on Matt Hancock
item.description: The statistician at Cambridge University accused the government of failing to provide accurate figures on the number of tests carried out. Test numbers remain below 100,000.

item.title: Queen 'may NEVER return to frontline duties': Monarch, 94, could remain quarantined in Windsor
item.description: Her Majesty, 98, who is currently residing with her husband Prince Philip at Windsor Castle may not be allowed to return to her public duties 'for years' due to the risk of catching coronavirus.

item.title: Minister hails Daily Mail's £3million advert fund to help struggling small firms
item.description: The Mail and its sister newspapers are offering 1,000 small companies advertising space worth £3,000 in Britain's favourite and most widely read newspapers.

item.title: US tycoon gives £200k to PPE drive as Mail Force donations hit £6.6million
item.description: Yesterday Mail Force - a charity created by the Daily Mail and its partners - received another major boost as former New York City mayor Michael Bloomberg donated £200,000.
item.media:credit: Getty Images for The Met Museum/

item.title: How much more can airlines take
item.description: Travel editor Mark Palmer asks how airlines will survive if travellers coming to Britain are required to quarantine for 14 days after airlines have already suffered for being grounded during the crisis.

item.title: Melania Trump pays tribute to fellow moms in heartfelt Mother's Day address from White House
item.description: Melania Trump broadcasted her address via Instagram on Sunday morning at the White House, where she's celebrating Mother's Day with her husband and their 14-year-old son Barron.

item.title: Lone children languishing in Greek migrant camps are flown to the UK after Mail's exposé
item.description: After the Mail highlighted children in squalid conditions on the Greek island of Lesbos, lone children trapped in Greek camps are among vulnerable migrants arriving on a flight the UK.

item.title: Stephen Lawrence's mother Doreen helps TV writers pen race-hate storyline for Coronation Street
item.description: Doreen Lawrence was consulted by the soap's writers about the plans, which will explore prejudice faced by the Bailey family. The ITV soap will tell the story of generational divides.

item.title: Thousands of motorists could join in a legal battle and sue Mercedes
item.description: Lawyers claim they have 'overwhelming evidence' of wrongdoing and accused the German manufacturer of 'deceiving the car-buying public'.

item.title: Supermodel Helena Christensen reveals she almost ran out of food in shark-infested waters
item.description: The 51-year-old was on a modelling assignment in the Indian Ocean with photographer Fabrizio Ferri when their boat broke down.

item.title: 'Sneak Up, Shout at the Virus, Then Run': Britons mock Boris Johnson's new 'stay alert' slogan
item.description: Boris Johnson has decided to ditch the 'stay at home, protect the NHS, and save lives' slogan in favour of 'stay alert, control the virus, and save lives'.

item.title: UK's crucial coronavirus R rate could be JUST below one, Boris Johnson admits
item.description: The Prime Minister made clear in his address to the UK tonight that how the nation moves forward to emerge from lockdown will hinge entirely on the R rate of the virus and keeping it below 1.

item.title: Boris Johnson reasserts his authority as PM as he rebukes Nicola Sturgeon
item.description: Boris Johnson tonight tried to reassert his authority as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom as he set out his lockdown exit strategy and rebuked Nicola Sturgeon.

item.title: Mother swan attacked by dog lives to see her cygnets
item.description: When the Sheffield swan's eggs did not hatch within the normal 42-day gestation period, locals feared they may have cooled too much in the hours the mother was away being treated.

item.title: TOM LEONARD: Little Richard was a rock 'n' roll wildman... and his private life was hair-raising
item.description: TOM LEONARD: Drug addiction, cross-dressing, 'wonderful' bisexual orgies, and voyeurism - Little Richard indulged himself royally and wasn't shy about it.

item.title: Mystery of the UK choir whose members had virus symptoms in DECEMBER
item.description: The first singer in the Voice of Yorkshire choir to become ill was the partner of a businessman who had returned from a trip to Wuhan in mid-December and developed a hacking cough.

item.title: Get fit in 15 minutes: The best nutrition and exercise for a great cardio workout in a small space
item.description: Nadya Fairweather recommends mountain climbers for a great cardio workout in a small space. British nutritionist Shona Wilkinson advises boosting cardiovascular health by eating berries.

item.title: Care home testing failure has turned the vulnerable into sitting ducks says Baroness Ros Altmann
item.description: BARONESS ROS ALTMANN: The coronavirus pandemic has shone a cruel spotlight on one of our greatest failings: our attitude towards the elderly.

item.title: Is it just me? Or is taking up cycling at 60 simply plain daft? asks Marion McGilvary
item.description: British writer Marion McGilvry, who has recently brought a bike, reveals she has fallen off it doing nothing more dangerous than attempting to put her foot on the kerb.

item.title: Piers Morgan says Boris Johnson's plans 'make no sense' as families still cannot reunite
item.description: Piers Morgan led the anger against Boris Johnson this evening with Britons questioning why some lockdown restrictions were eased but not the ban on seeing family and friends.

item.title: Two-year-old puppy ate rocks to survive after owner left him chained up and to starve to death
item.description: David Neanover, 36, starved his two-year-old Doberman pinscher in 2019, and he was sentenced to 180 days in jail on Thursday after being convicted in Ohio of misdemeanor cruelty.

item.title: Exposed: Modern beauty myths no woman should ever fall for!
item.description: British beauty expert Ingeborg van Lotringen, who has been a beauty journalist for almost 25 years, reveals the lessons that she's learned throughout her career.

item.title: Grammy-winning soul icon Betty Wright - who inspired Mary J. Blige and The Roots - dies aged 66
item.description: No Pain (No Gain) and Tonight Is the Night hitmaker Betty Wright passed away on Sunday morning, her niece Bella confirmed from Florida.

item.title: This is what 55 looks like
item.description: Sharon Hilditch MBE, 55, who lives in Liverpool, revealed how Chopstick facials, HRT and monthly eyelash extensions contribute to her ageless appearance.

item.title: Our guide to the 'duo-workout' trend
item.description: Anna Maxted reveals a selection of the best 'duo workouts' as the once-a-day rule for outdoor exercise in the UK is finally relaxed.

item.title: Paris remains deserted as France prepares to lift its lockdown tomorrow
item.description: On the final day of one of Europe's toughest responses to the pandemic, the streets around the Eiffel Tower, down the Champs Elysees and the Avenue de l'Opera in Paris were deserted.

item.title: Best books on demanding dads
item.description: British literary expert Patrica Nichol, shares a selection of fascinating books on demanding dads including Professor Chandra Follows His Bliss and Mum & Dad.

item.title: PM's exit plan in detail: What can people do during the next phase of the coronavirus battle?
item.description: Here, Boris Johnson's 'exit strategy' has been dissected to help Britons wondering what they can and cannot do during the next phase of the UK's war against the bug.

item.title: DAVID DAVIS fears Boris Johnson's lockdown decision will cause businesses to suffer
item.description: Boris Johnson's judgement on marginally relaxing the lockdown may be right, and it accords with the public mood. But it means that many more businesses will not survive the crisis.

item.title: Charlie Gard's parents tell of their joy as they release 20-week scan of healthy unborn child
item.description: Six months pregnant Connie Yates yesterday told of her delight - and showed the Mail the uncanny likeness of the unborn child to Charlie.

item.title: Flash mobs break out in Hong Kong as anti-government protests resume
item.description: Riot police chased protesters through Hong Kong's shopping malls and streets on Sunday as democracy activists launched Mother's Day flash mob rallies

item.title: Elsa McAlonan's Beauty Upgrades: How to extended lashes with the new super mascaras
item.description: Elsa McAlonan reveals a selection of the best super mascaras that lengthen and strengthen in just one coat. British beauty expert also shares the multi-tasking product loved by Scarlet Johansson.

item.title: Boris puts new noose around 'dead man walking' Matt Hancock's neck
item.description: The embattled Health Secretary will be tasked with delivering the Prime Minister's ambitious goal despite failing to hit his own 100,000 target for eight days in a row.

item.title: Elon Musk's model mom Maye shares cute photo of her new grandson X Æ A-12 on Mother's Day
item.description: Maye Musk, the mother of Elon Musk, nicknamed her new grandson 'X' in a sweet Mother's Day post on Twitter

item.title: It's the latest lockdown trend causing a stir on Instagram...
item.description: Two hobbies keeping lots of us sane during lockdown are baking and gardening. Now a new trend, which combines the two, is taking social media by storm: welcome to Focaccia Art.

item.title: Beverly Hills mansion where Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are living is surrounded by A-listers
item.description: The £14.5million, Tuscan-style villa in Beverly Ridge Estates is a stone's throw away from Hollywood heavyweights including Samuel L Jackson and Cameron Diaz.

item.title: Boris Johnson vows to 'reverse' coronvirus outbreak in care homes
item.description: In his address to the nation this evening, the Prime Minister said there is 'much more work to be done' in tackling the 'awful epidemics' in both care homes and in the NHS.

item.title: Freak MAY snow storm compounds lockdown misery for New Yorkers
item.description: The NWS said Islip, NY has officially had a snowier May than February. 'In case you need anymore evidence the world is ending, it's snowing in May in New York', one resident said.

item.title: I chose to isolate with my husband NOT my children
item.description: Joanna Moorhead who has been spending lockdown in Scotland with her husband Gary, explains why she left her children alone in London during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: The lockdown letters to warm your heart: children become pen pals with care home residents
item.description: Fourteen-year-old Otis Irwin and his eleven-year-old sister, Violet have been exchanging letters - yes, old-fashioned letters - with care homes residents Sandra Tait and John Brooks.

item.title: Wave goodbye to your microwave meals
item.description: Janneke Vreugdenhil, 51, who lives in The Hague, has penned a book filled with easy recipes for one. The food writer reveals her desire for singletons to revive their cooking skills during lockdown.

item.title: 10 pandemic proof trends that'll REALLY cheer you up this summer
item.description: British beauty expert Shane Watson, says there is still a need for fashion that makes us feel feminine. She reveals a selection of timeless styles that can be embraced during lockdown.

item.title: Labour MP gets a taxpayer-funded flat only six miles from her husband's home
item.description: Cat Smith, 34, has claimed £15,000 for seven months rent in Lambeth, London. The close ally of Jeremy Corbyn lives there with her husband Ben Soffa, the party's head of digital organising, and their son.

item.title: JANE GORDON: I really DO need a man at 64
item.description: British mother-of-three Jane Gordon, 64, who entered lockdown happily single and feeling smug about her life, reveals how a phone call from a long-married friend has made her question her attitude.

item.title: Morrisons extends Amazon delivery service to new stores
item.description: It comes as customers have turned to online shopping to avoid going into stores. Many also order one large weekly shop, instead of buying fewer items several times a week.

item.title: US coronavirus deaths top 80,000 and hit 1.3 million
item.description: On Sunday, the death toll in the US reached 80,308, and it has been revealed nursing home residents and workers now account for a third of these fatalities.

item.title: Led Zeppelin guitarist Jimmy Page is embroiled in fresh planning row with a neighbour
item.description: Jimmy Page, 76, is at loggerheads with his neighbour over the proposal to build a one-storey, underground level in the property behind his 1875 Grade I-listed mansion in west London.

item.title: Militant Tube union boss issues fresh message to his members telling them NOT to return to work
item.description: Mick Cash, boss of the the Rail, Maritime and Transport union (RMT) said that government 'mixed messages' could trigger a surge in passengers and have 'lethal consequences'.

item.title: Man has iron rod removed after it penetrated through his head - but he claims he 'felt no pain'
item.description: Kamel Abdel Rahman, 46, has received life saving surgery after a building site accident in Jerusalem left him with an iron rod penetrating through his head. Despite the injury he claims he felt no pain.

item.title: FIST-FIGHT erupts between Indian and Chinese troops at strategic crossing leaving several injured
item.description: Indian and Chinese soldiers clashed violently at an strategic mountain pass in the Himalayas on Saturday. Several troops were injured with soldiers from both sides throwing both fists and stones.

item.title: Bank holiday bloodbath: Four 'targeted' shootings in 24 hours in Sheffield
item.description: Sheffield was plagued by gun violence from 12am until 7.30pm as 'two groups of men' battled it out in Burngreave, Sharrow and Nether Edge. Pictured, police cordoned off the area.

item.title: Justin Fashanu Foundation 'offering support to five secretly gay footballers'
item.description: The players, including two from the Premier League , have sought support from the organisation - which was founded and is run by Justin's niece.

item.title: Britain announces 269 more coronavirus deaths - the lowest daily tally in six weeks
item.description: Britain has suffered a further 269 coronavirus deaths - the lowest figure in six weeks since March 29. However, there is always a dip in daily deaths at the weekend.

item.title: Boris Johnson's speech in full: Prime Minister's lockdown address to the nation
item.description: Boris Johnson tonight unveiled a road map from lockdown in a pre-recorded address to the nation from Downing Street. Here is his speech in full.

item.title: Thousands of unsold cars are pictured lined up at port
item.description: The long rows of vehicles were pictured at the Port of Sheerness on Sunday as UK car sales plummeted by 97 per cent.

item.title: New coronavirus infections accelerate in Germany
item.description: The Robert Koch Institute for disease control said in a daily bulletin the number of people each sick person now infects - known as the reproduction rate, or R - had risen to 1.1.

item.title: Seven arrested after mass brawl erupts at birthday party
item.description: Police said they were called to reports of a large group of people fighting outside an address on Wemsley Grove, Tonge Moor, shortly before 8pm on Saturday.

item.title: Trump launches Mother's Day rant where he hits back at Obama's criticism of coronavirus response
item.description: Donald Trump slammed Barack Obama in the midst of a tweet rampage Sunday in response to criticism from his predecessor of the federal response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: PIC EXC: Simon Cowell and Lauren Silverman fill their Rolls Royce with toys for their sons
item.description: The music mogul, 60, and his partner, 42, filled their $500,000 Rolls Royce Phantom with a heap of toys for their sons as they stepped out in Malibu on Saturday amid the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Piers Morgan and Vicky Pattison flirt on Instagram after she admits she 'fancies' him
item.description: Piers Morgan and Vicky Pattison have been indulging in some light-hearted flirting after the reality star gave an interview admitting she is 'obsessed' with him.

item.title: 'The only plausible explanation': Coronavirus DID leak from a Wuhan lab - Australian expert says
item.description: A respected author and China expert has said evidence has emerged suggesting the coronavirus must have leaked from a Wuhan laboratory.

item.title: Nine in 10 Britons do NOT want lockdown to end immediately
item.description: As Boris Johnson prepares to unveil his 'exit strategy', Deltapoll found just 4 per cent believe the draconian restrictions should start to be lifted now, and another 7 per cent were not sure.

item.title: Early drawings and letters by Peter Rabbit author Beatrix Potter sells for £213,000 at auction
item.description: A collection of early drawings and letters by children's author Beatrix Potter has sold for £213,000 at auction. The haul included Potter's personal first edition of The Tailor of Gloucester.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle hire David and Victoria Beckham's highly-rated former Hollywood aide
item.description: Mother-of-two Rebecca Mostow, 70, was brought in by Prince Harry and Meghan Markle to help run their day-to-day lives in Beverly Hills, reports suggest. She previously worked for Prince.

item.title: Only 52% of Brits say they would download the NHS contact tracing app
item.description: Robert Jenrick, the communities secretary, said the app may need to 'adapt' or 'move to a different model' amid teething problems since its launch in the Isle of Wight.

item.title: Can YOU spot the vegan roll in the bakery?
item.description: A tricky new brainteaser, created by Holland's Pies, challenges the nation to find to vegan roll in the bakery scene - but can you beat the 11 second record?

item.title: Mother-of-two, 24, reveals how she fitted a soap dispenser from eBay
item.description: Chloe Lee, 24, from Ashton-under-Lyne, came across a TikTok video which revealed a secret trick to hold a soap dispenser in the 'pointless circle' in your sink to avoid having bottles on display.

item.title: Seven million people 'will be on hospital waiting lists by autumn because of delays'
item.description: A study into the harm done by the UK-wide lockdown suggested delays caused by the virus have meant 1.3 million extra patients were added to waiting lists to see specialists. Pictured is PPE arriving today.

item.title: Kate Middleton's best friend Emilia Jardine-Paterson welcomes third child
item.description: The couple, already parents to sons Leo and Alexander, announced the arrival of daughter Lucia Beatrice India on March 20 in the births section of The Times newspaper yesterday.

item.title: South Korean super-spreader is linked to 54 new coronavirus cases
item.description: The total number of cases linked to three nightclubs in Itaewon in Seoul, visited by a 29-year-old patient who had tested positive for coronavirus, increased to 54 as of Sunday afternoon.

item.title: South Korean super-spreader is linked to 54 new coronavirus cases
item.description: The total number of cases linked to three nightclubs in Itaewon in Seoul, visited by a 29-year-old patient who had tested positive for coronavirus, increased to 54 as of Sunday afternoon.

item.title: Coronavirus CAN enter the body through the eyes
item.description: A team led by Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine have found the eyes produce ACE-2, known as the 'gateway' into cells inside body.

item.title: Jo Malone admits having a strict routine is 'vital' to control her anxiety
item.description: The British perfumer and mother-of-one, who is currently isolating at her Chelsea flat with her husband and son, told The Sunday Times Home lockdown has brought her family closer together.

item.title: China furiously hits back at coronavirus cover up claims with 11,000-word article
item.description: The Chinese foreign ministry has rejected accusations made by politicians including Secretary of State Mike Pompeo that Beijing had withheld information about the virus.

item.title: Snot right! Binmen call the police after bag of used tissues is put out for recycling
item.description: Binmen in Port Talbot, South Wales, were forced to call the police after they discovered a bag full of used tissues. The workers left the bag where they found it after discovering it contained used tissues.

item.title: How to make Starbucks' Frappuccino at home
item.description: TikTok food influencer @caughtsnackin, from London, revealed all you need to do is blend up ice cubes, espresso, cup of milk, chocolate syrup and granulated sugar to recreate a mocha frappe.

item.title: Nurse, 51, who died of coronavirus had previously spoken out about lack of PPE for NHS staff
item.description: Onyenachi Obasi (pictured), 51, was a nurse for 20 years and died on May 6 after spending five weeks on a ventilator. Her niece said she had mentioned not being properly protected.

item.title: Adorable Great Dane pup called Hector wins canine selfie competition
item.description: Seven-month old pup Hector has won top spot in a dog selfie competition after posing for an upside down snap for owner Lauren Draper at their home in Stevenage, Hertfordshire.

item.title: Final UK death toll from coronavirus 'could be worse than the Second World War', according to study
item.description: A study led by Philip Thomas, a Professor of Risk Management at the University of Bristol, found than 675,000 could die from the knock-on impacts of the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Hapless carpenter crashes to the ground and smacks his head after ladder slips from under him
item.description: Hapless handyman Josh Coates, 30, fell from the roof of a building after the ladder he was standing on slipped away from the wall. CCTV footage showed him falling and banging his head.

item.title: Man, 53, is found shot dead with horrific head injury at his £730,000 exclusive home
item.description: Jeremy Bowes, 53, died instantly of a brain injury last month after he was shot in his garden in picturesque Minety in Wiltshire. Officials say the case is non-suspicious.

item.title: British Army tests new smart rifle scope that locks onto targets and 'never misses'
item.description: Israeli firm Sharp Shooter developed the scopes to find targets and place a red square around them, reported The Sunday Mirror. The device can be fitted to any rifle at a cost of £800.

item.title: The app that lets you 'cheat' your way to the start of supermarket queue
item.description: Almost 2000 Brits have signed up to Visualping, which was developed by engineers in Canada to get alerts when Tesco, Ocado, Morrisons and Waitrose update their delivery times.

item.title: Matt Hancock now 'on borrowed time' after battles with Michael Gove, Rishi Sunak and Boris Johnson
item.description: Matt Hancock is living on 'borrowed time' as Health Secretary following clashes with the three most powerful members of the Government over the Covid crisis, The Mail on Sunday has been told.

item.title: Mouthwatering footage of a meal in the 3-Michelin-star Le Louis XV restaurant in Monte Carlo
item.description: Foodie Egor Appolonov filmed the 1,060-euro (£930) dinner he enjoyed with his wife, Anna, at Le Louis XV-Alain Ducasse à l'Hôtel de Paris restaurant in Monte Carlo. 'It's mind-blowing,' he said.

item.title: Mum leaves the internet in stitches after microwaving lemons but was left with burnt marks
item.description: An Australian woman attempted to clean her microwave using the lemon in water trick. But she missed the vital step of putting the citrus fruit in water, which resulted in heavily burnt lemons.

item.title: Trusts set up to preserve fortunes of rich families can protect yours too
item.description: We give you the lowdown on those investment trusts where family money still influences the way that they are managed.

item.title: Rescue pup Micky finds loving family after 'writing' a Valentine's Day card to potential new owners
item.description: An adorable rescue pup found a forever home after writing a 'Valentine's Day letter' to potential new owner. Micky, one, mow lives with new owner Kris Karwowski, from Cambrigdeshire.

item.title: 'That's not fair - give me a break': Matt Hancock pleads to PM in clash over UK's COVID-19 response
item.description: Matt Hancock is living on 'borrowed time' as Health Secretary following clashes with the three most powerful members of the Government over the Covid crisis, The Mail on Sunday has been told.

item.title: Ministers fear 'The Blob' - made up of political opponents - will sabotage reopening of schools
item.description: Ministers believe 'The Blob' - an army made up of political opponents and union barons - is colluding to politicise the coronavirus outbreak, The Mail on Sunday has learned.
